passage_text: Put the plate in the microwave and select a cooking time. Cooking times will vary depending on the size of the potato and the power of the microwave. Most medium to large potatoes will take between 8-12 minutes to cook at full power. 1  Try putting the potato in for 5 minutes to begin with, then take it out and turn it over so that both sides cook evenly. 2  Place it back in the microwave for another 3-5 minutes, depending on how soft it is already. 1 If you are cooking multiple potatoes at once, you will need to increase the cooking time by about two-thirds. 2  For example, if one large potato takes 10 minutes to cook, two large potatoes would take between 16-17 minutes.

Report Abuse. How to Cook a Sweet Potato in the Microwave Step1 Scrub sweet potato with a vegetable brush and water. Step2 Use a fork or small knife to poke holes in the sweet potato. Step3 Place the sweet potato in the microwave and use the baked potato setting. I prick mine all over with a fork. Wrap in plastic wrap and for a medium size (say about 8 inches long fairly thick) I microwave for about 8-10 minutes. Then I take it out and check and return for an addition couple of minutes if it still feels hard when I stick it with a knife.

Oven Bake. Cook whole sweet potatoes just like you would make baked potatoes. Prick each washed potato several times with a fork, wrap each one in foil and bake them for about 40 to 60 minutes in an oven preheated to 400 degrees Fahrenheit. Exact cooking time will depend on the size of the sweet potatoes; they're done when you can easily cut into them and their flesh is soft.
